photo.description: I recently scanned on some colour negatives from 1991, including this one - of The Little Mermaid in Copenhagen. The original picture was rather dull - wet rocks and dark metal on a cloudy and drizzly afternoon - so I messed about with it a little in Photoshop Elements 8. It's still not a great picture but it's probably better than the original.
photo.tags: 1991 copenhagen denmark film056 lillehavfrue littlemermaid colournegative film
photo.title: The Little Mermaid

photo.description: Obligitory tourist shot of The Little Mermaid. Quite why this is one of the most popular destinations in Copenhagen is beyond me. It's not that big, it's backdrop is some ugly industrial buildings and wind turbines, and it's a bit out of the way. But there were loads of people there when I came to take this picture.

photo.title: Copenhagen

photo.description: This statue of the Little Mermaid sits on a rock in the Copenhagen harbour in Churchill Park. This small and unimposing statue is a symbol of Copenhagen, and a major tourist attraction. The statue was commissioned in 1909 by Carl Jacobsen, son of the founder of Carlsberg, after he had been fascinated by a ballet about the fairytale. The sculptor Edward Eriksen created the statue, which was unveiled on 23 August 1913. He used his wife Eline Eriksen as the model. And of course I, Youssouf, had to have my picture taken with this small but beautiful landmark. I had to stare at her for minutes. I did not really get her attention. Have a look at the blog post at Youssouf's Sheeplog with this photo. To see where this photo was taken exactly, have a look at the interactive map and zoom in and out for a better overview. Youssouf (cuddly sheep / world traveler)

photo.title: Looking at the Little Mermaid - Youssouf in Copenhagen, Denmark - 16 August 2007

photo.description: This statue of the Little Mermaid sits on a rock in the Copenhagen harbour in Churchill Park. This small and unimposing statue is a symbol of Copenhagen, and a major tourist attraction. The statue was commissioned in 1909 by Carl Jacobsen, son of the founder of Carlsberg, after he had been fascinated by a ballet about the fairytale. The sculptor Edward Eriksen created the statue, which was unveiled on 23 August 1913. He used his wife Eline Eriksen as the model. And of course I, Youssouf, had to have my picture taken with this small but beautiful landmark. Here I am, with the statue in the back. Have a look at the blog post at Youssouf's Sheeplog with this photo. To see where this photo was taken exactly, have a look at the interactive map and zoom in and out for a better overview. Youssouf (cuddly sheep / world traveler)

photo.description: My Mobile 365 Contribution - 8th Feb. 09 The old cannons at Katellet, military fortress on the boundary of City/Østerbro in Copenhagen close to the Little Mermaid. Believe it's long time since the cannons was last in use - but still makes an exciting atmosphere. I can recommend to visit this place - reckon it's much nicer during summer time. Not like today in ice cold winter winds.
photo.tags: mymobile365 kastellet military project365 copenhagen denmark grass trees cannon gun langelinie 080209 2009 8th feb february
photo.title: My 365 - 8th Feb
